text: We've eaten in and ordered out from Chazz Palminteri in the past couple of weeks and both times we were happy with the food, service, and the reasonable prices. We love especially the fresh oyster and the bistecca Di Manzo. Everything was well prepared and excellent.
Great service, lots of menu choices and the food was simply delicious.  Great spot to eat & catch a show or just enjoy the Times Square area.

Have been to the 2nd avenue location and now the 2nd time at the new location. Decided to come back to new location after a New York Ranger game (they won btw).  Service was excellent and very Attentive. We know many of the workers so it is nice to go to a place where they know you. The special which was grilled calamari was excellent. For entrees I did the cream sauce pasta special with the shiitake mushroom sauce which for me was a test as I don't care for thick cream sauces much but this was not drenched in a heavy sauce so it was great. I'm hooked in a way so take this with a grain of salt. Worth a try but for those budget conscience it is not very inexpensive. Hope this helps you. Came again 04/14/19 and it was great as usual. A must try but if you are walker conscience expect to pay for great food and service. Very worth it.

The food is delicious and the presentation is beautiful! The restaurant itself is really pretty, and the waiters are all really friendly. I was hoping to spot the man himself but he wasn't in that night.

Passed the restaurant a few times during lunch time and love him as an actor and decided to give it a try. We went on a Friday night. Food was delicious. Price point was on the high end but not disappointed. Plain coffee was definitely well over priced. Will definitely return but at some future date. Not anytime soon.

Aesthetics! This restaurant is gorgeous. Whether it's a cozy date night, or a night out with your friends, this is the place to go! I was craving Italian food and my friend suggested Chazz. I'm in love with their atmosphere and interior. Service was top notch. I expected nothing less from a restaurant that looked like this. We had a few people tending to our table. With the constant glass top offs, clearing plates or crumbs, our staff was skillfully there without trying to make it known. They started our table off with bread and we placed our orders. I tried their baked clams, lobster ravioli, as well as their pasta with white clam sauce. The bill for those three items were about $100 with tax and tip. They have amazing Italian food. Portion size - perfect. It wasn't too much where you needed a box. All the girls at my table finished their entrees and considered themselves full. By the end of the night, we were really pleased with dinner. The restaurant was mostly empty on a Friday night but we enjoyed that we could be quiet or loud. The staff even helped us take pictures. They deserve a very positive review from my guests and I.

Where can you go and meet the owner AND Forest Whitaker? My friends this is the place. I call it "Perfection at Its Finest!"Atmosphere: 5/5 Food: 5:5We stumbled into this fine establishment, without a reservation on a Saturday night, and the found space for us. The server was phenomenal in his attentiveness and knowledge about the menu. He made us feel very welcomed and made great recommendations! The restaurant is a beautiful, elegant restaurant but it still has a "home feel" to it. It is very spacious with a lot of seating, and nice decorations. The food was phenomenal! I started my meal with minestrone soup that was truly authentic and flavorful. I got a chef's special pasta with a lobster tail, scallops, and clams. The sauce was so delicious and the noodles were a classic, homemade noodle. To make the night perfect, I got to meet Mr. Chazz Palminteri himself and Forest Whitaker! Perfection.

WOW! This place was delicious. We actually had reservations at another restaurant, but passed Chazz, read the menu and made a quick switch. My food was so delicious, the service was fast and everyone was kind. Not only that, but...the restaurant is owned by a famous actor (Chaz Palminteri lol) and he was sitting right there! Made for a real New York experience! Will definitely be back and highly recommend to all!

The place was very nice nicely appointed....although very loud...even with only a couple of tables occupied.  Service was very prompt.   I did have trouble understanding the server as he had a very heavy accent.  The food was average at best...well presented but no better than a more routine establishment...certainly not worth the price....ordered wine and it appeared they were rationing...as the portion was the smallest i think id ever seen....especially for an upscale business

My wife and I went here after a show on July 3RD, every phase of dining here was a pleasure for the both of us, service, atmosphere, quality of food combined with taste was a great experience.I would recommend this place to anyone living or visiting NYC.We made a return last evening March 9 with another couple, we were all just as pleased as we were the first time.This place is a must stop for dinner whenever we visit the city

As a one-day tourist to see a Broadway show, my daughter, her mother in law and I stumbled upon this delicious, Italian restaurant. We had the halibut special that was so delicious and perfectly prepared.  The mother in law had the Bolognese and scraped her bowl clean. The waiter was very informative and and attentive. The restaurant was clean, pleasant and a delightful experience.

Well, I knew that if Mr. Palminteri put his name on it we wouldn't be disappointed, & I was right. The food was so fresh and delicious. Our server Aulon was amazing! Thank You!To  thoroughly please four women on International Women's Day says a lot.Pricey but worth every penny, we'll definitely be back. Kudos to the entire staff!

I thought that this restaurant was very good. All the food tasted fresh and all the employees were very nice. In the dining area the lighting felt romantic. Came here before a show and for the fact they partner with IHG for points. It was empty when we arrived so hard to tell how regular service would be but the restaurant started to fill up around 630.

Came here with a friend for restaurant week-great time! I started with the carrot soup which surprised me how good it was. Light, flavorful, and not super creamy. For the main course I ordered the pesto gnocchi and I ate the entire dish- every single bite and no regrets. I got the tiramisu for desert which was good but not one of the better ones I've had and portion was small. The food came out really quickly which was good and bad because we were hungry but also wanted some time in between the courses to talk. They did stick us in a corner though and it was a bit chilly there but my friend and I stayed a couple hours after our meal and were not once rushed out.

Great restaurant. All the waiters were so polite and the food was amazing.The waiters are very friendly. Highly recommend the pasta! The place is very friendly and the waiters are very polite and professional.

This has to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants! From the moment we walked in, we were taken care of and waited on hand and foot. Outer waiter was excellent, and the food left our mouths watering. We will definitely be back!!

I got to admit, was disappointed. I had higher expectations considering the reviews and the prices. Definitely on the pricey side for Italian Food, but I'm fine with that if the food warrants it. I don't think it does. The appetizers, fried calamari, buffalo mozzarella and clams oreganata. Nothing special, average tastes, clams organata were probably sub average to tell the truth, dry and not very tasty. Main course, linguini w/clams, homemade papadelli, linguini neri w/seafood. Linguini w/clams were tasteless, had to add crushed red pepper to get anything out of it. Linguini neri w/seafood was probably the best of the 3 dishes, but multiple times cruncher on sand. Probably need to scrub the shell fish better before throwing into the dish. Again not a bad meal, just not great either especially for price and location.

Tried this place out for Restaurant Week and overall it was a good experience. The decor and atmosphere was elegant and traditional. My friend ordered the chicken parm and I had the chicken piccata. I tried her chicken parm and it wasn't bad but I've definitely had better. The chicken piccata was very tasty! I wish the portions were a bit bigger bit again its probably because it was from the Restaurant Week menu lol yikes! If you are coming Restaurant Week its actually a good deal because you get an app, entree, and dessert for $42! We also did the special they had on their bottles of wine for $45. The Chardonnay was amazing!
Not sure why they gave us only table located between exit and kitchen entrance.Food was very salty and Room was very loud.4 star . Hmmm Prefer local restaurants

This was hands down one of the best eating experiences (and especially the food) that I've had in the longest time. My husband made reservations here mostly because we love Chazz (sonny) and the Bronx Tale is one of our fave movies. To start, the service here was top notch. We had a really nice waiter who was very accommodating and paying close attention to us if we needed anything, whether it was a refill of our water, a pour of the wine or to clear plates. Attention to detail was really on point here. We ordered so much food it was actually really embarrassing but we couldn't decide what app we wanted so we got an order of the burratta special and a shrimp with a cream sauce over crispy bread. The burratta was over watermelon and it was so delicious. The shrimp app had the best sauce on top of it. We ate every bit of it and we're dipping more bread in the sauce. My husband ordered the filet mignon and I ordered a seafood over spinach linguini special. It was similar to a zuppa dipesche and had scallops, shrimp, lobster and clams on top. The dish was excellent. My husband let me try some of his steak and OMG it was to die for! Highly recommend both dishes for dinner. Then we just had to order the creme brûlée. Again, it was awesome. We finished the whole thing. Then they brought out a tiramisu dessert because they overheard us talking about how we were there for my bday (my bday was back in October but this was a gift for my bday) and so of course we had to eat that as well. The cake was so good also. Leaving here we were so full and satisfied. The place is expensive but worth every penny. As I said earlier this was some of the best food I've had in a long time and I hope to come back here some day soon.

If you want an authentic Italian food experience this is it . The decor is warm and cozy, definitely not loud but service could have been a tad less aggressive that said. I had to order my all time favorite the broccoli we had two sides of Broccoli Rabe and the fresh Pollo Francese ( lemon chicken). The Broccoli Rabe was cooked perfectly tangy bitter veggie soooo good for the body and soul - goes well together with the chicken (garlic & lemon) and balanced with a bottle of Chuck Hill... we did not have room for dessert but next time TY

Really did not like the service here - the waiters are constantly rushing you. They give you very little time per course by showing up to ask if you're done, already reaching to take your plate before you can answer, and this is when our plates were still half full. They also switched 3 different waiters on us so they would forget things such as our wine order.The food was edible but very underwhelming - my steak was undercooked yet somehow still tough to chew and the sauce was too salty. My friend's calamari pasta tasted like the kind you buy in store and microwave.

My fiancé and I ate here before heading to an evening showing of Network. The restaurant is extremely clean and discerningly decorated. The menu offers a lot of wonderful Italian options. We started with the spicy calamari appetizer which was delicious and fresh. I went with a special dish for my entree: spinach fettuccini with shellfish in diavolo sauce. Everything was fresh, perfectly seasoned, and delicious. My fiancé ordered the filet mignon with mashed potatoes. The filet was perfectly cooked and seasoned, as were the potatoes. Our waiter, Aulon, was also wonderful. He was mindful and checked in on us appropriately. Overall we had a wonderful experience here.

This is one of the best italian restaurants in nyc and author ave. We had almost every thing on the menu so far it was all a ten plus. Prices are low for nyc prices . I am a friend of the best chefs in the world so i know my food.. Good look chaz see u on arthur ave

In town for a couple of shows. The hotel we were staying at recommended this restaurant. Great staff, great atmosphere - we were seated in our own little alcove which was lovely and private.  However, our food was average. We ordered the Pollo Alla Parmigiana and the Branzino.  Both were good but definitely not above three stars.

My daughters and I were in NYC for a Broadway show, stayed at the Cambria.  We decided to dine here one night - pleasantly surprised, although I should not have been because I am well aware of Chaz Palminteri's reputation for doing everything top-notch. (Excuse my crassness but I think the man must piss excellence!)For the table, we ordered the mozzarella with tomato and vinaigrette.  Lovely presentation and delicious! The bread came out warm and fresh! Heavenly!I had the lobster bisque (EXCELLENT) and the Cesar salad (with arugula because the romaine scare is still in effect, and I appreciated the option).  My daughters ordered the spinach fettuccine with alfredo sauce (fabulous) and the rigatoni with rosetta (also terrific).  Service was excellent.  Very pleasant atmosphere, as well!  Prices are as expected for NYC.I very much enjoyed our evening here.  I hope we can go back next time we are in NYC.

My girlfriend and I went here for the first time on December 30, 2018, we had 4:30 reservations and because of traffic and the parking lot next to the restaurant we were late.  We called the restaurant twice and the person who answered the phone could not have been more accommodating. When we arrived at 5 o'clock they quickly sat us and we explained that we had 630 theater tickets, our very polite and friendly waiter assured us we would be out in less than an hour and we were! I was very impressed that the staff worked as a team to make sure that our order was placed quickly and we received our food very timely. I had the buffalo mozzarella my girlfriend had the eggplant mellenzane both were exceptional and the presentation was absolutely beautiful. My girlfriend had the Rolatine di Pollo, I had the rigatoni with broccoli rabe in the pink sauce, both were absolutely delicious and once again presented beautifully. I love the wine list, lots of great choices for wine by the glass since my girlfriend drinks white and I drink red. I cannot wait to go back to this beautiful, elegant  and exceptionally well run restaurant! My only two very slight critiques would be, our dessert was good not great, we ordered an apple strudel with vanilla ice cream and fresh berries, the ice cream and the fruit were delicious and very fresh, the apples were a little undercooked and dough a little rubbery but it was still a good dessert.   The other very slight critique was the music playing in the restaurant, while I love bands like Staind and Train, I would have envisioned Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett or Bocheli, but that's probably just my personal preference.

Let's start out with the fact that I was greeted by a well dressed man in a tux no less. Ultimate in class however after being seated in the "walk-in section next to the door I began to question me choice. Continuing on to the bathroom situation where I had to utilize the neighboring hotel's bathroom (not a hotel restaurant) which took a grand total of 15 minutes, we sat to order dinner. The menu is concise and can be changed to whatever you like according to the waitress I tried a off menu mushroom risotto, which came not al-dente but crunchy, after sending back a $30 entree they proceeded to re-fire a risotto...I'm not gonna ask how you refire a already garnished dish but they did. After receiving the well overdone risotto with still undercooked crunchy bits I was asked to get something else by my server. Which I obliged now 1.5 hours into my meal with my co diner who had finished a while ago. I then order pasta and some vodka sauce and sausage which is what my counterpart had. This came out in a glorious 45 minutes later and well under cooked with less than a tablespoon of sausage. The total bill for a thrice sent back entree and a few drinks $149.59 plus tip. The best part of this meal was the restock. Don't waste time or money.

The restaurant looks nice and the food is okay. Those are the only positives. The staff were largely indifferent and provided mediocre service. Although our water was refilled, the staff was overall not attentive (e.g. our dishes weren't cleared for about ten minutes despite being empty and thus clearly done) nor friendly. The two tables next to us seemed to receive marginally better service for some reason. They were more dressed up than we were but we certainly weren't sloppy or poorly dressed (and even if we were, it's no excuse for poor service). The food was nothing special and not worth the price. It wasn't awful but it wasn't anything to write home about. Hence why it receives two stars instead of one. The tables against the wall were too close together. You could easily hear people next to you. I found a hair in the napkin but didn't bother to tell anyone. Biggest complaint? They didn't give us all of our change. They kept about $10.45. We considered that their tip and didn't leave anymore. I've never had the tip automatically taken unless it was added to the bill ahead of time and that's something different.

Warm dry oysters, soggy fries , plastic gummy calamari and uncooked icy cold half crepe with missing ice cream.spent $100 for a dinner that got me and my friend sick to our stomach. Obviously the oysters were not kept at the right temperature and they were not delivered on top of ice as they should.Vomiting and fever.thankfully today is a brighter day but I will surely never order from them again.

No pictures because our table of two was snug in a corner and I didn't want to elbow the people next to me or be obnoxious. Service was extremely attentive. Our wine glasses were topped off before I even knew I was ready. I had the pappardelle Bolognese which was spectacular and way more food than I could eat. My SO had the rigatoni which was also yummy (I stole a few bites). Due to the romaine issues no cesar salad so I opted for the spinach salad with pears and bacon dressing, not my normal choice but I loved the salad. Dessert was tiramisu which was delightful and a stronger coffee taste than you normally get (which I prefer). The only cons are it got a little loud in there once all of the tables were full and some tables were a tight squeeze (but that's just NY). I would recommend if you're looking for Italian.

My husband and I had reservations in a neighboring restaurant on Thursday night. We walked in and they were so rude and the burning brick oven smell made us run out. We walked across to Chazz restaurant and asked if they had a table even though we didn't have a reservation. They were very accommodating and gave us a table. From the beginning I knew this was going to be a good experience. The waitress was very friendly; we were never rushed and the food was phenomenal. The half bottle wine list was pricey but we were able to overlook this because everything else was perfect!! Thanks for saving our date night and we will definitely be back... btw the buffala mozz was amazing!!!

Usually when a restaurant contains the name of a celebrity it leaves a lot to be desired, not so with Chazz Palminteri, this place exceeded my expectations big time. First, the restaurant is great looking and then everything gets better. The service is very concerned and very responsive. The real home run is the menu, it has something for any taste, but there's no denying it's Italian. Everything that we ordered was cooked to perfection. And the finishing touch was some great desserts. This is a go to place that I look forward to returning to soon. Last night my wife and I returned to Chazz Palminteri's after attending an theater matinee. After being seated, I showed the maitre d my review and the response that I received, he gave me a cursory nod. Shame on me for expecting a little more enthusiasm. So much for that. Once again the meal and service was great. I will continue to recommend this restaurant to any friends going to the theater or just looking for a great place to eat.
Food was really nice but drinks were surprisingly expensive. The cost built up quickly without our awareness!

Absolutely loved this place! The manager was so accommodating and nice to me and my sisters. The food was amazing, wine was lovely, and service was great. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for an authentic Italian cuisine!

Two words, VODKA SAUCE. The riggatoni a la vodka is out of this world at this restaurant. Portion sizes are small, not to mention the restroom is located outside of the restaurant, however service and food is delicious.
Great food and great service. We were seated at a table in an awkward spot but the manager was very accommodating and found us a new table on a busy weekend evening.

Forget all the poor reviews for this restaurant because this place is fabulous. We just got home after a terrific dinner with our family. We started with salad, oysters, and fried calamari. For our entree, my nephew's fiancé and I had the chicken parmigiana, my niece and nephew had the pounded veal chop, and my wife and her sister had pasta. Everyone loved the appetizers and their entree. The one thing I can't speak to was desert, because we were too full to order desert. The ambiance was terrific, the service was first class, and it was a very fun, festive atmosphere. The only thing that would have made the evening better was if Chazz was in the restaurant and stopped by our table.

Just had late lunch here. The place was very well done. Had pappardelle con ragout. Out standing. Pork tenderloin scalloping .Another home run.Wait staff great. However, there was a table of four that ruined the whole experience. Two tipsy loud broads and two tipsy obnoxious guys . They knocked down a fewOther than that, 5 stars for the place, staff, & the food

I really didn't expect Chazz Palminteri' restaurant to be very good. I mean how many good restaurants are there in Midtown and not too far from Times Square? Not many that's for sure and for that reason I kept my expectations in check. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the restaurant was. The dining room itself is simple with tables nicely spaced from one another. Service was good but not great and that could be because we got there late at the end of the day. However our server steered us to a few specials which we loved. We also had a good pasta which was nicely cooked and an excellent veal chop.Chazz Palminteri is a solid choice for good Italian food.

We were looking for one "fancy" dinner, preferably Italian not too far from Time Square and this place hit the nail on the head!!! Ambiance had a fancy feel, but no one was overly dressy. Customer service was like Disney guest services!! Food was Amazing! It is a little pricier, but we felt we got what we paid for, an amazing meal!!!

This used to be a place of quality. A cpl of us had the discuss veal scallopini with sage and it came out with so much lemon that one could not determine what they were trying to accomplish.   Sage and lemon?????  With veal.    To many ppl on the floor and it seemed as if everyone was more determined to pay their rent than attending to their customerNow let me mention that we own four restaurants so our life is exposed to food.   I was entertaining guest from Europe deeply disappointed and staffing was a mess.   Serving appetizers and salads  together.   Just a mess. The lady that seemed to be the head staff member or owner literally wiped her nose with her sieve in the dining room.  Just a mess and I was terribly embarrassed    I would say with all there us to eat in-this vicinity why eat here    We have a place On 49th street and are deeply disappointed Try another place!   Sad but a reality

My wife and I dined here after seeing the 2018 Rockettes Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall.The restaurant is located at 30 W. 46th St between 5th & 6th Avenues, located in the Cambria Hotel and a short walk from Radio City.We had a 1:45 reservation but arrived approximately a half hour early. We were very pleasantly greeted by the hostess who showed us directly to a table.The restaurant is very richly stated and my wife and I were very pleased.Our server Besrik greeted us next and asked if we wanted sparkling, still or tap water to which I ordered a bottle of San Pellegrino. We also ordered our cocktails which were a Negroni for my wife and a Heineken for me.We then received a basket of fantastic Italian Bread (crispy outside crust soft inside) with olive oil with garlic for dipping. Besrik then told us about their specials of the day which wanted one of each as my glands started to salivate.My wife decided to go for the Pre Fix Lunch which is an appetizer, entrée and dessert for $ 29.95. A super great value for the portion size and food quality. She chose the Insalate Bufala App, Calamari Sicilliana Entrée and Ricotta Cheesecake.  I chose the Polpo Griglia for my app. It was the single best grilled octopus I've ever eaten. It was four perfectly grill tentacles over finely diced broccoli di rapa. For my entrée I chose the Osso Buco special (one of my all-time favorite meals.) over Risotto. A huge veal shank with meat so tender I did not need a knife. It melted in my mouth!My wife had a coffee with her cheesecake which I tasted and it was fantastic. I went with a cappuccino and Bailey's straight up.I can't say enough about the total experience. It was fabulous from the moment we walked through the door. You can't ask for a better server than Besrik! He is truly an asset to the restaurant. This was our first time here but I guarantee it will not be our last. I highly recommend this outstanding restaurant.Mr. Palminteri thank you for one of the Best Movies of all time - Bronx Tale, (I've only see it about 100 times (no exaggeration and Thank you for an Outstanding place to dine.

This is my first EVER y'all review I literally downloaded the app just to review this restaurant . My glass was never empty... our waiter Joseph was amazing and attentive.... the food omg the food... not only was it the best seafood I've ever had but it may have been the best meal I've ever had. If I died right after this meal I'd be more than satisfied.

Horrible service! Walked in there with my family, asked the hostess if they are busy and she looked and said "NO" then some guy walked up to us looked at us up and down and said "yeah we can't offer you a table here, you guys can have a high top by the door" basically told us that we don't belong there! I can't believe it! Stay away from that place!
I have been here numerous times for lunch and dinner.  Consistent, excellent food, attentive and professional service.  One of the better Italian places in NYC.

Came here with some friends and were promptly seated around 7PM. Was pretty packed for a Saturday night. This place goes back to basics and overall was nothing special. Had the chicken parmigiana and it was good but the menu was filled with Italian classics and lacked originality for my fellow foodies.

I have not been to NY in years. So glad I found this place. Staff were very nice. Ambiance was wonderful. Menu options were plenty. Wait staff was friendly and informed. Food was great. Chicken Parmesan could feed 2. Veal Marsala was great, couldn't finish it all. Only thing I can suggest is, if you need to leave by a certain time, let them know. They were in no rush to have us leave. Which, can be rather nice. You decide.

There's nothing about this restaurant that I don't love. From the time you walk in everyone makes you feel welcome. The bartenders mix a great martini. The grilled octopus with broccoli ran is the best!  I send so many of my clients there. I love it!

Got a gnocchi in veal ragu when I was in town for work recently. It was ok, nothing special but exactly as advertised. It was rather salty and there were one or two chunks of fat but there was a decent amount of veal which was tasty and the gnocchi was solid.I'd be ok trying Chazz again but don't think I'd seek it out, especially considering the price (nearly $30 for pasta).

This restaurant was disappointing. Pasta was over cooked. Bread dried out. Expensive given the preparation that went into the food. There are so many good southern Italian restaurants in Manhattan, but this is not one of them.
Been here twice loved it . Food,service and selection all great Chaz was there the first time and said hello and took pictures with the patrons.

My wife, son, and I came here on a Friday night. The ambiance was nice. The wait staff impeccably dressed and attentive. The meal however was another story. My wife ordered the Rollatini Di Polla. She took a bite or two and could eat no more. The taste was terrible.She asked the waiter to take it away which he promptly did. She ordered a pasta bolognese dish which arrived quickly and tasted just ok.My special homemade spinach fettuccini seafood fradiavalo just didn't quite taste right. The sauce was plain and not spicy at all. The side of broccoli rabe was very good though. The chocolate gelato for dessert basically had 'freezer burn' and tasted as such.Overall this was not a good dining experience for highly priced New York establishment.

Truly one of the most obnoxiously pretentious restaurants I've ever been to... and neither the service nor the food live up to the attitude. I asked for a full bodied red wine... was told they don't have "House wine"?? Wasn't asking for house wine, but apparently the server assumed that I couldn't possibly be posh enough to mean otherwise. Asked for the wine list. The server literally rolled his eyes. For having so many servers (all impeccably dressed by the way), I was rarely checked on. Finally there was one very nice and helpful waiter at the end, but by then I was already fed up with the place. Came for dinner; ended up ordering one glass of wine and an appetizer and walked down the street to another Italian restaurant that didn't have such an attitude.

Ate at this Italian restaurant tonight, it was right next to our hotel. Totally blown away with the service we received as well as the food. Rarely do I ever leave a review but this was just unbelievable. Bring your wallet tho but Worth every penny

Crazy Bernie is a huge fan of Chazz' place. Tammy the Tornado and I have gone twice so far each time we fly in from California. The first trip in we were blown away by the quality of the dishes. Seasoned perfectly as if you were a guest at his house. We flew in to see Bronx Tale on opening night and to our delight Chazz himself was sitting 2 rows behind us. Made the trip!  We just landed tonight and hope to eat at his awesome restaurant tomorrow night Thursday October 4th. I would love to get a picture with Chazz to hang on the wall of my Crazy Bernie furniture store out in Fresno. This is the official NY Italian restaurant of Crazy Bernie.

My name is Gaetano LoGiudice. I walked by and saw Chazz Palminteri's name. I was greeted right away. I was seated down in a nice table. I got served right away with water, menues, drinks. The bartender introduced herself with a smile, she said her name was Anits. I was so impressed she spoke italian in a italian restaurant.. Doesnt happen often in New York. I loved how i was served with the bread, olives and cheese.. The original Romano. When i opened the menu i was amazed, as an Sicilian i recognized so many dishes my mom used to make. I tried Linguini nero.. Such an amazing dish. The wine list is just impressive!  I will have to come back again. I recommend this place to everyone who loves and knows italian food.. The way i do. Everything was just perfect. The service from Anita is something you dont see in New York restaurants anymore. So polite, naturally nice , welcoming people like its her house. Great job Chazz!!!!

One of the best meals I've had in NYC to date and my wife and I dine out every other day. I was amazed that everyone, not just the waiter, but hostess, bartender and literally all staff members warmly greeted us. The cheese and olives would cost you $10 as an antipasti in the Bronx. The entrees were delicious. The only thing that could have made it better is if Chazz came out himself to say hello. Also, the restaurant has a gorgeous interior. Bottom line is that it is authentic and exceptional including service, ambience, and food. This is a very special place because for me there are more bad Italian restaurants in NYC than anywhere else. We need places like this where an Italian person can go eat and not be disappointed.

Dined at Palmenteri this  evening. The food if you have a yen for Southern Italian is pricey but well above average. Service prompt and professional and surprisingly the place was crowded for Manhattan on Labor Day weekend. Since all the glitteratti had decamped for the Hamptons the crowd was a mixture of noisy tourists and inhabitants of the adjacent hotel. Although  I do not feel that atmosphere is critical however there is no ambiance here. The restaurant is conveniently located at the edge of the theater district and is worth a shot for apres or post theater. But I can only give it three stars because of the foregoing.

This rating is only based on a happy hour experience, and mostly based on service. We stopped in for their oyster special, $1.50 each. Great deal! The oysters were magnificently large, but sadly were the most underwhelming in flavor that I've had. Maybe our server was having a bad day, but she didn't seem very happy about our presence and was very brusque; so that was uncomfortable. It was not crowded, so I'm not sure why she was so unwelcoming. After we finished our oysters, they gave us a basket of chips, which was very nice, but was oddly incongruent to the white tablecloth atmosphere.

Upscale Italian - the parmesan cheese and lemon twist olives are the perfect pallet opener along with the bread and garlic olive oil. Soup of the day is vegetable zucchini. I plan to get a few drinks and stay at the in house hotel.

I visited the restaurant​ on June 1st followed the play Bronx Tail.  Both visits were a big treat.  I was impressed with the service and had the pleasure of meeting Chazz.  The food and wine were exquisite​.

I had to try the new location after having such a great experience at the first location.  Food was delicious as I expected and the service was amazing.  The first time we went was a very memorable night for me.  I told the waiter that Mr. Palminteri is one of my favorite actors and A Bronx Tale one of my favorite movies.   I just had to try his restaurant.  Mr. Palminteri just happened to be in the restaurant that day and he came over to our table.  What a gentleman!  He took the time to speak with us and even took pictures - which I will always cherish.  We went to the new restaurant just before seeing A Bronx Tale on Broadway - a winning combination.  Thank you Mr. Palminteri for making a fan very happy.
Not great but not bad either.The meal will be fine but nothing memorable.

A group of us came here for the first time for their restaurant week special. We had a reservation and were seated right away. Our waiter Nikko was excellent- he was knowledgeable of the menu, kept our wine glasses filled, and welcoming. I personally had the Caesar salad for an appetizer that was great, light dressing. My entree I did the chicken parm which was paper thin and a side pasta of alla vodka. Dessert I had the Italian cheesecake which was a very small piece. We shared the special Pinot Grigio for $40 and the special was $42. Can't beat it!Would definitely come back if in the area again.

Just left. Service was great. Everyone from the hostess to the bartender, our waiter and server. Food was awesome. We came for the restaurant week menu. I had the veal ragout, skirt steak and cannoli , my date had the house salad, chicken  parmigiana and cheesecake....WOW. Food was awesome. We will definitely be going back. Only complaint is from across the street i passed right by ...lol.

I was excited to go to Chaz Palminteri's since I am a fan and from the Bronx! I went with the lunch special which includes salad, main and dessert. I had chicken parmigiana. I am Italian and cook. I have a high standard. I was disappointed because the sauce was very sweet (too much sugar). The salad was fine as well as the tiramisu. It is a good location, near my customers. I will give it another try. It was a very nice decor and bar.

My god this place is amazing! The food is delicious, the decor is beautiful and most importantly, the service is impeccable. I came here on a random whim this Friday for my birthday. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and immediately seated. Our waitress was very helpful with helping us pick out a wine pairing and suggested some options for us to eat. I ended up with chicken parm (because I'm super basic lol) and my friend ordered the mushroom risotto. The risotto was a tad bit hard, however, the flavor was out of this world!! The chicken parm was equally as delicious. I will definitely be back here.

So I'm sitting here with my wife after our dinner. We did not have the right waiter. This little bafoon never mentioned specials even though when we sat down we were the only ones in the place. My meal was ok my wife's tasted like shrimp with dishwater risotto.  Certainly Chaz or Sonny we're not represented well tonight. I will never recommend
The best Carbonara I've had in NYC! Atmosphere was upscale, service was great except for a little hiccup checking in. Good for special occasion or if you're catching a show nearby. Not touristy!

Went here with my family before going to Bronx Tale. Although pricey (as you would expect in NYC) the food was really good. Both kids had spaghetti and meatballs and my wife, mother and I all had a variation of seafood and pasta.  All were very good and the service was friendly and efficient. If you are looking for good Italian food you can find other less expensive options but this is a fine one for a special event.

We came here during restaurant week. I have to say it's good in general but not too good that will make me want to come back. I guess I just had a super good experience in another restaurant yesterday that set my standards higher for all restaurants. I tried the salad (insalata della casa). It's good. But nothing special. The calamari siciliana has pretty good calamari and a few scallops. I like the calamari the most in this dish. All the rest ingredients are ok. I don't think the whole combination is very good in general. The tiramisu is ok. The pinot noir from California is good, but no comparison to the one from France. The service is pretty good though. We ordered a bottle of wine and they kept filling our glasses for us. In general it's like 3.5 stars. Food is more like 3 stars and service is more like 4 stars.

Just came back from a first-time lunch at this restaurant.  Pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious; all four of us ordered from the pre-fix menu.  The fried calamari was tender & tasty.  And we each tried each other's choice ~ my pappardelle bolognese was cooked perfectly; the chicken w/champagne sauce was very tasty; the skirt steak salad was fresh & tender; and the pork tenderloin was also tender & tasty.  We collectively gave it high reviews, and often go for lunch in mid-town Manhattan.  We will visit this restaurant again, trying different items from the regular lunch menu next time.

Excellent food and service!Tip end restaurant with great home style Italian food.The spinach fettuccine special with Lobster tail, scallops, shrimp and clams delicious!Stuffed Chicken with eggplant and provolone another great choice!

The food was amazing.  I got the linguine and clams it was like I was in Palermo.  My finance got t the prefix lunch menu and it was a very good deal.   The dessert was the only thing that was not that good.   We got the New York cheesecake and it was subpar.  The service was excellent

Unbelievable place!!! The mushroom pasta appetizer stole the show but all other entrees right behind! Our table ordered The filet and BY steaks - both killer!!! Also carbonara and parperdeli bolognese. The house made desserts were off the charts. The service staff was so hospitable which was the best part

DO NOT GO UNLESS YOU HAVE RESERVATION! I tried walking in with my family and was treated poorly by staff because they were disgusted that we would try walking in and didn't reserve a table before. When asked to sit the 4 of us as the high tops n st to the bar they said "if you really want to" and was finally seated to where the bartender who waited us barely checked in on us. After ordering a couple of overpriced appetizers my wife and I decided to find a better restaurant that cared.

Delicious. Classy. Excellent service. Dined here with my son before a Broadway show. We had an adorable private booth. My son had salmon and I had the gnocchi. Both excellent. We also had dessert. The crepes with warm chocolate filling were AMAZING. Definitely going back.

I enjoyed the cheese, olives, bread and bolognese.  It was delicious.  My wife had the VITELLO TRE FUNGHI and it was like eating a well prepared piece of veal with a disgustingly sweet sauce best suited for ice cream. It lacked flavor and salt.  It was difficult to eat.

Total perfection from when you first walk in to an amazingly delicious dinner. Loved every moment including seeing Chazz Palminteri so exciting he was very sweet to my daughter. If your in New York this is the place to go.
The best Italian food , impeccable staff, great ambiance and very close to my office.I will be back!!!
This was a surprising fun and great food place.  All the food we ordered was exceptional.  thank

Hit this restaurant late on a Sunday night with a large group (11 people) and they had no compunction about serving us lovely food with attentive service. The fried calamari appetizer was good, as were the mozzarella/tomato/basil, and my linguini with clams and a red sauce was quite tasty. Everyone came away happy with their meals.
The decorating is nice. The service was nice. The food is fresh and good.Afternoon Happy hour $1.50 oyster my favorite. Dinner menu is good for dating and business.
Awesome lamb, I could have chewed the bone. Wait, I think I did. Chicken Parmesan was excellent too. Great cheesecake. Waitstaff was extremely attentive and tolerant.

We wanted to try out this restaurant for some time. I was in the mood for Italian and we were not disappointed. We were greeted at the door with a smile and welcome. The wait time was only a few minutes. Once we were seated, our waiter promptly went over the specials for the night. My wife chose one of the specials while I picked from the menu. We started with the Melon & Prosciutto appetizer which was very good and tasty. My wife ordered the shrimp and pasta while I ordered the sausage and pasta ( I do not remember the names of the meals) they were both outstanding, flavorful and just enough for us. After our wonderful meal, we ordered dessert. The Chocolate Mousse was silky smooth and delicious. I then ordered an Espresso with a Lemoncello on the side while my wife also had a Lemoncello. After the meal and our after dinner drinks, our waiter brought over two shots Grappa, on the house, which we weren't expecting. Overall, our dining experience and service here was exceptional and we will return. I give it 5 Stars.
The bread and dipping oil put on the table to begin with are addictive!!  The service was excellent, the food was amazing.  I will definitely be back.

A true delight. Pasta made in house. Wait staff authentic and pleasant. Excited to see Branzino on the menu - ORDER THIS, it will not disappoint- and it's enough to share if you get an appetizer / salad to start. My daughter ordered the gnocchi with meat sauce - best gnocchi ever have had. Great dressing on the Caesar salad. Only criticism- small wine list by the glass

Came here for restaurant week and it was definitely worth it. There was a slight wait to get our tables(about 7 min) We got a bottle of red - had the calamari and the tomato mozzarella! The calamari was delicious, the best I've had wish they gave us more pieces. My main dish was the gnocchi w/ pesto - so scrumptious. My bf had the Vitello di bianca which he loved. For dessert we had the cheesecake and gelato - both a great way to finish the meal. Atmosphere was elegant.

Come here to dine and get deals done.  Classy dining room and attentive service.  Housemade gnocchi with veal ragu was melt in my mouth fluffy and satisfying.  Very well made with care.  The Bronx Tail was also interesting but the pasta was overcooked.  It had ample seafood with delicious sauce luckily.  Nice burrata to start.  First glass of prosecco was flat but second glass was bubbly.  Zero room for dessert but I'm sure it would've been good.

Beware! Stay away! The service at this restaurant is designed to cheat customers. We were twice swapped wine vintages, differing from what was offered on the menu! We were served lesser vintages, containing inferior wine. I was told that "white wines from 2013 were vinegar" and "white wines from Italy in 2013 are for salad dressing." Im an interested wine lover and I know for a fact that the wines we were served actually cost 40% less that what we were being charged (even accounting for all restaurants' considerable markup). The first time we inquired to the Manager, he was embarrassed and offered to adjust the check. Then were were introduced to Antin, also a Manager, who was unapologetic and told us his job "is to make money from customers". Antin was argumentative and talked in circles, hoping he could stall us long enough while knowing we had an early curtain to catch. They could have handled this unfortunate situation SO many different ways. Mr. Palminteri should be embarrassed ... if ever he finds out! The whole evening left a bad taste in our mouth. (Pun intended!). We will never be back.

I tried this place out with 2 co-workers for lunch during restaurant week.  We were seated right away and the ambiance was very Zen-like - I really liked the décor.  The service was attentive and on point.   Before we ordered I had asked the waiter about their regular pre-fixe lunch menu and he told me they don't offer it during restaurant week.  I thought that since I had asked, they should've let me order from it since it had more choices and was actually $1 less!  Now for the food: Appetizers - we had the Insalata Ceasare, the Calamari Fritti and the Tomato Mozzarella. All were very good, the calamari were tender and served with a spicy marinara sauce.  For the entrees we had the Tilapia Livornese and the Vitello Di Bianca.  I really enjoyed the veal, however, it was served luke warm and the mashed potatoes were actually cold it also came with some julienne string beans.  I happen to like my food piping hot, so this was a little disappointing to me.  For the dessert 2 of us had the Italian cheesecake and the other, the gelato.  The cheesecake was superb, however it was such a skinny sliver, not a wedge how cheesecake is usually served, but a sliver so thin, that I had to scrape it off the dish to eat it, leaving me wanting more, much more.  I found that all he portions were on the smaller side and I'm sure it was because it was a  restaurant week menu,  which is a huge let down,  because it is not such a bargain anymore when you are still left a little hungry.

This place can definitely be considered fine dining. From the moment we walked in we were met with beautiful smiling faces who took our coats and sat us right away (we had reservations). The waiter was attentive and charismatic and the atmosphere was elegant and clean. I had the chicken parm which was perfect and my date had mushroom ravioli and he ate every last bite. They have an extensive wine list and delicious desserts. This restaurant is highly recommended!

This restaurant is supremely okay. We made a reservation for 130 and didn't get seated until near two. While most of the food was good there was a hair in one of the dishes and the staffs response was very nonchalant. Additionally, I asked if black tea was available and the waiter said "we should, I don't know" and never came back. So, while the food was okay (probably less than ok given the price to be honest) customer service was lackluster at best.

Great meal in a classic NYC setting.Everything was top notch and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good Italian food in Manhattan. I've seen some negative posts with regard to the service, but I can tell you that wasn't our experience at all. We are fairly picky and expect the service to match the quality of the food whenever we eat anywhere, and especially for higher priced places....and I believe Chazz's place lived up to expectations.

What happened Chaz?  So you move your place to little Brazil and it isn't the same experience.  From a dark gangster ambiance to now a canned stuffy tight seating smug atmosphere.  So let's go over everything eaten.  First, one of my favorite glasses of Pino ever.  Delicious.  Started with the lobster soup.  Great color and a broth taste that would put me back on the beach in Maine.  The lobster was a bit over cooked but all and all a good dish. I had veal Marsala.  Ok so I was told i was getting veal Marsala.   Veal cooked perfectly but with a demiglaze.  So sweet I could barley swallow it.  Over cooked soggy green beans.   And here's a hint,  get rid of the fake mashed potatoes they were offensive.  She had gnocchi with a meat sauce.  Obviously the chef just found out about salt and wanted to share this amazing find with us because it was  uneatable.  Dessert was apple strudel.  Cold apples in a crust seasoned with some odd flavor that would make my dogs hair stand on his neck. Also had a cold cappuccino and the waiter brought another red wine in a white wine glass.  Unfortunately my last stop at what I used to landmark one of my favorite city spots.

Lovely restaurant with a nice ambience. Our waiter was extremely attentive and helpful, he made honest recommendations and accommodated if we wanted to switch out a side and what not. The bartender sent out the wrong drink and without hesitating when we told him, he promptly went and had a new one made. If it were only for service I would award it 5 stars however the food was good but not spectacular. Overall, it was a good meal, with excellent service.IG: @fluent_in_food

Awesome from the first moment I stepped in until I finished a perfect espresso pre-theatre.  Apps were awesome.  We had minestrone soup, lobster spun, grilled artichoke and beet salad, a special order carpaccio all before the theatre for two.  Two glasses of montepulcino wine, for under a hundred dollars.  Can't wait to go back for dinner for a full meal.

Lovely restaurant, great ambiance, excellent, attentive wait staff, loved the bread served with a dish of olive oil, and a plate of olives and delicious cheese.  It went downhill from here.  I had chicken Parmesan .... chicken was flattened to the point of being chewy.  Not enough sauce and the side dish of penne was lukewarm.  My husband had the red snapper with gnocchi special.  He said it was "ok not great".... I'm not a fish eater so didn't try it.  We had dessert.... apple strudel with ice cream and chocolate mousse.  Again, ok but not great.  We were really excited to try this restaurant after seeing "A Bronx Tale" the day before, so I'm sorry I can't give a better review!

Wow! My husband brought me to this restaurant last weekend to celebrate my birthday and all I can say is wow! First of all, I'm very picky. Also, we are Italian and both pretty good home cooks. We eat at restaurants often, especially Italian. The food was so delicious and presented beautifully. The service was fantastic and all of the wait staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Every time a waiter walked by our table they checked to see if we needed anything, even though they were not assigned to our table. They were very polite and asked how everything was many times. The space is modern and very clean with a very manageable noise level. I cannot wait to go back for another dinner! This is an absolute must experience restaurant, especially in NYC where there are so many overrated places to eat where the prices are outrageous, this restaurant definitely stands out and did not disappoint! Amazing!!!

Made a reservation for my anniversary. When we got there, we stood by the door that says "Please wait to be seated." Got passed NUMEROUS times by several different people that didn't pay any attention to us. Finally, a waiter told us to wait in another section. When we got there, the hostess was extremely rude. She was cutting us off, told us to sit very rudely, had an attitude the whole time, and I caught her rolling her eyes several times. When we finally got seated, 40 minutes AFTER our reservation time, then the service was decent.  They forgot one order of wine, and ran out of another one only after we ordered one glass. The manager gave us a free dessert. Food was good, but definitely not what I expected from a 5 star restaurant. Very disappointed.

The worst dining experience I've ever had in my life.  We had an 8pm reservation on Saturday 12/2.  We weren't seated until 8:45.  The hostess couldn't explain what the problem was (or give us an ETA), and then she told us our table up front would be ready as soon as the party that was sitting there left.  That group, meanwhile, was anxiously and obviously waiting to pay for at least 20 minutes.  We felt like we had to wait because we were a party of 6 in NYC on Saturday night (including 3 kids).Our first food came out at 9:45, which made us lucky - another party stormed out just before our food came out because they had waited over an hour to be sat and then had waited over an hour and a half and still had no food.  The food was NOT worth the wait - tomato sauce tasted like a combination of Ragu plus Campbell's Tomato soup, and much of our food was cold.  It was clear that this place does NOT have "logistics" and "management" down - they couldn't turn over tables because they were either understaffed or not staffed with the right people.  I would not go back to this restaurant if they paid me.  Save your time and frustration and book somewhere else.  They don't even deserve the 1 star.

I went here last night for my 50th birthday party dinner on 12/2/17. We had a reservation for 630pm which we were on time for but was made to wait for about an hour while a table was there since 4pm! The least they could've done was pay for a round or two of drinks at the bar while we were forced to wait but chose to do nothing! The food was good and service was good once we sat down but don't think we will be going back due to a bad first impression.

I had such high hopes for this restaurant,  we planned our trip to the city for the day around it, alas...We had lunch reservations for two. We arrived and the Hostess seemed very confused when we said we had reservations for 12:30. She stammered then hastily sat us a a tiny table for two in the bar as if we were a bother to her. There was so little room that our drinks and appetizers couldn't fit causing our lovely waiter to have to juggle. Our food runner noticed how cramped things were and we said we would like to sit in the main dining area,as we saw other parties of 2 happily being shown to their tables and our table in the bar was simply too small to comfortably have a meal at. We were offered two tables be put together by the Manager and  we politely declined. At this point we who were of course nicely dressed began wondering why we were not initially or upon our  request seated in the dining room, it made no sense and We were made to feel unwelcome.  We were finally seated where we should have been, in the dining room, not a table in the bar large enough for cocktails only, not plates.  The cold treatment by the Hostess , along with having to ask twice to be seated in the dining room put a damper on our meals so I can't fairly at this time review the food.  This was not the dining experience we expected and we have no desire to return after being treated in such a manner.

Absolutely delicious food, impeccable/cheerful service, beautiful restaurant, clean modern bathrooms in the adjacent Hotel Cambria. Huge menu, lots to choose from. We shared Pappardelle pasta to start with black truffles, green peas and a delicious sauce. Also had Osso Bucco Veal Shank over Risotto, Shrimp Scampi (really big shrimp), and Black Bass with homemade gnocchi. Sorry I can't remember the names of all the sauces and ingredients. Everything was DELICIOUS and because the portions were so generous,we all brought home doggie bags. Our waiter, Al, was highly professional, friendly but not intrusive, and very informative about everything on the menu and not on the menu. We will definitely return.

Beautiful restaurant, excellent service by everyone and especially our server Al! Grilled octopus appetizer is spectacular and all of our entrees hit their mark. I ordered salmon, rare and it was perfection. Homemade tiramisu for dessert, don't miss it! And Chazz himself was in the house and we were able to have our photo taken with him. It was an all around amazing dining experience.

What a total disappointment. The service is beyond horrible. We told our waiter that we are a time crunch so we ordered a green salad and pasta bolognese with a side of french fries.  We got there at 12:30 pm by the time we got our green salad it was 1 PM.  Again we said to the guy we have to leave here by 12:25. We finally got the pasta and our french fries at 1:20 pm.  We asked for ketchup which we never got.  We never got to eat our pasta. So to sum up - the salad was good, the pasta looked good and I think the fresh fries was good too.This could have been a one time situation but there were three different waiters we spoke to so....,.

I was very impressed with the food and the service offered here.  The food was very authentic and robust with flavors of Italy. The atmosphere was very inviting and warm.  My friend told me it was Chazz's place but I sort of blew it off as...just the name being used by someone else.  One of my favorite movies of all time is The Bronx Tale and The Usual Suspects.  But when Mr. Palminteri walked into the restaurant, i was blown away.  Even though his aura and appearance was larger than life, he wasn't.  He was a very humble and down to earth kind of person.  When I return to New York, Chazz will be on my list of must stop places.

Wow!!!  It is really hard to put into words how much we enjoyed our dinner this evening. Fabulous wait staff. So attentive and made fantastic recommendations. The pasta is homemade and fresh. The food is incredibly delicious.  We will come back when we are in NYC again!
The restaurant was beautiful, food and service incredible, Chazz came in for dinner, came to our table greeted us and took pictures with us! The nicest celebrity I have ever met

My boyfriend took me here as a surprise for our third anniversary celebration last week, and it was one of the best restaurants we've ever eaten at! The crazy thing is that I didn't even know this place existed... How is that possible? I'm a huge Bronx Tale and Chaz fan. In any case, they started us off with deliciously warm Italian bread with spiced olive oil, olives and cheese. Delicious.For our main course, we ordered the duck ravioli and the shrimp risotto. The ravioli may have been the best thing I've ever tasted. Whatever sauce they use was incredible. We finished off the night with tiramisu and cheesecake...again no regrets here.Although I was tempted to order their "Bronx Tail" dish... I'm saving it for my next visit. Thank you guys for a wonderful anniversary experience!
They sat us in a cold dark corner. The food was terrible. My fish was filled with tiny bones and the service was poor. Huge disappointment.

Omg is this place for real!! The food was AMAZING, the atmosphere was calm and relaxing, and the prices for he amount of food were good.For 3 people:2 appetizers 3 main pasta dishes 2 desserts = came out to be $147They also sang a mini happy birthday for my sister with a candle on her crepe brûlée.I will definitely be going back there again.You will try so many new things and will love it! Definitely great for a date, engagement party, rehearsal dinner, and anything else of special occasion.

Wereally wanted to like this restaurant. We did like the food. We each had salmon, cooked perfectly. Delicious. Short wait time as well. Here's why I will not go back: the service. They forgot our sauces on the side, disappeared and never came back to see how how food was or if we needed anything (we did want another glass of wine). We had four different servers although it wasn't busy and one poured tap water into our glass of sparkling water without asking. We had over half a bottle left and it was not replaced after this error. We also had to ask for a refill of our water glasses twice and chase down the check. Very nice people, poor management.

I really wasn't expecting it to be this delicious. I highly recommend the carbonara. The prosciutto, bufalo mozzarella and tomato appetizer is amazing. They provide a beautiful bread basket with dipping oils and antipasti

Great food and service. I'm originally from Italy and I usually have very low expectations for Italian places since became Italian-American now. However! The good was delicious and would love to come back one day.

The staff reminds me of an old favorite of mine, GINO's off 60th. Excellent staff, great ambiance and the food.....outstanding. But then, anything that Chazz touches turns to a gem. Godetevi e venite affamati!

Great location, close to the Marriott Marquis/Times Square. Nice ambience. We liked the bread basket and olive oil starter. We had the appetizer octopus broccoli rabe that was char grilled with a pepper kick, cooked perfectly. We tried the radicchio salad with roasted red pepper and a nice balsamic vinigerette. Entrees were the chicken rollatini stuffed with cheese, eggplant, very light and flavorful. We also had the rigatoni with sausage and broccoli rabe in a pink vodka sauce, and it was very good. The wait staff was helpful in answering questions.

Thank you Chazz.  We had a little pre-birthday dinner for our son.  The food was great! Two orders of the excellent Bronzini -along with good salads and wonderful mashed potatoes- and one spaghetti with meat balls-not truly Italian, but really good.  We also had delicious desserts.The way staff was exceptional. Please keep up the fantastic service.  Thanks again Chazz. We will be  back.

Well, I'm here now dining alone since I'm staying in the hotel attached to this place. There are only two other people here and it took 20 minutes for someone to ask me for my order. This is not a good start for something new.  I'll report back on the quality of the food. I pray that it makes up for the slow service.

I took clients to lunch this week and decided to try this new restaurant.  The decor and atmosphere was beautiful.  The menu had a very large selection.  Everyone  seemed to  enjoy their food although a few commented that their food was a bit salty.  The service was very attentive,although, not experiencedOverall, it was a good experience and I would return with clients.

This is some of the worst Italian food I've eaten anywhere. If you don't like (or have an allergy to) seafood, don't go because your menu choices are relatively limited. I ordered the chicken parm (although it has the obligatory pretentious name on the menu). The chef needn't have bothered with the mozzarella, as it slid off when cutting into the chicken. The penne was mushy and overcooked. The cheesecake tasted like a bland pound cake had been run through a blender with canned whipped cream. The waiter hovered. There is just nothing good to say about my meal.

This place is amazing, the food is top notch. The portions are satisfying and the service staff is fantastic. I can't say enough about this restaurant and I've been telling all my family and friends about it.
Nice atmospheric and the chef was friendly. Introduced himself without his title and was welcoming. Excellent food! Would recommend to anyone who's in the neighborhood or stop in before central park
Had lunch at their new location since we were seeing A Bronx Tale. The decor was clean and modern. The service was great and of course the food was excellent. Defintely will be returning.

This was my first time here for a pre theater lunch and the food was wonderful . We ate from the Restaurant Week menu and each item was well prepared, delicious and beautifully plated. The service was excellent and the decor modern and pleasant. One caution; do not try to use your American Express card. I tried and it was declined which seemed impossible. I called Amex from the restaurant and they said it wasn't me it was the restaurant which was not authorized to accept Amex!  I knew it couldn't be me and was embarrassed that the card was declined despite knowing I have no pre set spending limit. I used another card but the restaurant should make this clear.

Would give this place no stars if possible. Charged me for my entire table's bill and then my own portion twice but didn't mention this to me at all upon presentation of the receipt. Mind you, half of our party paid in cash so unclear as to why any card would have been charged the whole portion of the bill? Regardless, I noticed all four transactions the next day and called to confirm they had voided the charges and the manager knew exactly who I was as I imagine they had anticipated this call. Accidents happen but it's a little unbelievable the waiter would fail to mention this? The manager apologized but was almost dismissive when explaining they voided them as if this meant they didn't happen or no explanation should have been necessary. A word to the wise-avoid this place. Shitty Italian restaurants are a dime a dozen here in NYC-at least go somewhere that can cop to an honest mistake. Or not make said mistake in the first place.

I've never been so disappointed with Italian food. Seriously, it's one of my top three cuisines I cannot live without so imagine how saddened I was after dining here. I don't even want to discuss how we had to wait for a table despite having reservations so let's just dive into how upsetting the Restaurant Week meal was.Pappardelle with ragout - I stuck my fork into one piece of the pasta and it ripped thru to the end of its wide strip, indicating how soft it is. When I witnessed this, my immediate thought was, "This is not al dente. This cannot be a good meal if they manage to mess up pasta." And I was right...Red snapper - Tasted fishy, in a not so good way, as in I hope I won't get sick tonight. It was off, it was chewy, it was suspicious. I'm really hoping the fish doesn't make a reappearance tonight.Tiramisu - a 1.5"x1.5" cube of a dessert, mainly here since it's necessary to offer a dessert at the end of a meal but it was such a disappointing dish that they might as well not serve it. Why is the serving in the size and shape of an ice cube? Cutting costs, maybe. An indication that the chef don't care about food however is highly likely.The whole thing at most costs $25 per person, and that's being super generous, with gratuity. But since it's RW, we paid a hefty bill (doubled in fact!) for an abysmal dinner. Mamma mia, come va??!!

Delicious food , servers are outstanding , restaurant manager couldn't be more attentive he recommended a really good wine for dinner. We went in for restaurant week , had a great time. My only concern was the signage to get to the restroom , that can actually use some improvement. We meet Chazz Palminteri , awesome night.

Had lunch during the work day with friends for a birthday celebration. Food was delicious and service was friendly and attentive. The calamari were very tender and delicious.  We happened to have gone during restaurant week so we ordered off that pre-fix menu but the portions were generous and much to choose from.  Can't wait to go back. Did I mention the perfection of the martini?

This is in the heart of the theater district.   Had the veal, Osso Bucco.  It was off the charts delicious.  Appetizers included the grilled octopus, calamari all exquisite.  For dessert had the cannoli.  Plus the double espresso and the sambuca.   Our table of seven was extremely happy.  Looking forward to our next opportunity to eat here.

"Sonny had five fingers but he only used three." Recently had a late family "sit down" at the new Chaz location in midtown. The new modern decor/atmosphere brings this old school Italian joint into the 21st century. The food was delicious, and the service friendly and professional. Our cugine from out of town loved it, especially the veal scolopine. Just as we were finishing up, we were told "Now yous can't leave!" As Chaz Palminteri himself came over to greet us. A true class act. "The saddest thing in life is wasted talent", and this place has a ton of it. Will definitely be back.
First time here and it was a great experience (service, food & atmosphere). We had the appetizer sampler & it was excellent. Osso Bucco was phenomenal as well!!! Highly recommend

Ate at new location last week. Not sure of prices at other location, but these priceswere high. Gotta figure in this area of W46 between 5th-6th, prices would be high. Foodgood though, Branzino and Fra Diavlo, grilled Calimari. Solid restaurant but $165 for 2.

This restaurant would have to be one of the best Italian restaurants I've eaten in, in a long time. The service is exceptional and the meal quality is truly scrumptious. Add what seems to be an extensive wine list and the place comes highly recommended!

We had called to see if this restaurant was wheelchair accessible. They said it was and to a degree it is. The main door leaves you on a level with stairs that do not allow wheelchairs to pass, however, the middle door has a more spacious layout where a wheelchair can easily roll in and out of. The restroom has its own set of stairs so that's not wheelchair accessible at all.Regardless we decided to dine here since my dad is a huge fan of Chazz. The service from start to finish was impeccable. The manager was beyond nice and allowed us to take our time and sit and talk before they switched over to dinner service. They constantly refilled our drinks but made sure to leave us alone while we were eating.They start each meal with bread and olive oil. The bread was just okay but that's not really what you come here for, anyway. I ordered the chicken rollatini which was delicious! The mashed potatoes on the side were also a hit. Dad ordered a penne dish which he couldn't stop raving about. For dessert I wanted creme brulee but they were out (whomp whomp) so I got the panna cotta instead. The panna cotta was delicious and served with a fluffy homemade whipped cream. Two meals with beer, soda, and dessert came out to $100. Not terrible considering the amount of food you get and how good it tastes. Usually I'm wary of a celebrity-owned restaurant but Chazz hit the nail on the head with this one. But seriously guys, you need to add another bathroom. One tiny unisex bathroom for this big location? And it's up 3 stairs? Come on.

Absolutely lovely restaurant...made reservations via email.  They confirmed within a couple of hours.  We arrived at 6:30, greeted by Nicola who was so helpful and friendly.  He turned us on to a wine we had never had...Fattoi Brunello, so good!  The food was amazing, reminded us of our tour of Italy last year.  Would most definitely recommend!
Stopped in again with my daughter after the auto show.   No reservations  felt welcomed great meal.

Another wonderful meal,   HunnyBunny had a Shrimp Dinner, I had Chicken parm.  The Matre'd was friendly the service excellent all the breads were fantastic.  Had a dessert Coffee this time It was great a good time had by all.  Oh and the Hostess is a hottie.  Hope one day to be able to meet the great Mr Palminteri.
One of the best lunches I have had in along time! Service was excellent, thanks Miguel and the steak was honestly better than some of the high end steakhouses in NYC, will definitely come back!
Beautiful atmosphere. Wine portions were great, and the food was very good. The staff was very attentive.

We came a group of 6 for a dinner.The atmosphere was nice, though the food eas very bad and expensive.No special flavours, very basic in a bad way.There are so many good Italian restaurants. This is not one of them.

The food was amazing (had the clams oreganato and the veal saltimbocca and some 2011 Banfi Brunello di Montelcino )......decor gives that great old school vibe.....Nicky is a first class maitre d and makes every guest feel like family.  Plus, a real treat to meet Chazz!

5 stars for ambiance, design, location and the fact that Chazz was there when we were there and allowed us to take a photo of him.  1 star for the Bartender.  She was wearing a crop top that might look cool at an outside bar in a Miami  but tacky for a place like this.  Despite that, we had planned to stay and have dinner and three friends were going to join us shortly but the bartender gave off such an unfriendly vibe that we decided to finish our drink and go elsewhere for dinner.  On a positive note, the menu looks amazing.  Will definitely try again but will sit at a table so we have a different experience.

The best Italian restaurant I've been to, hands down. The Sinanaj family know how to run the business and keeptheir clients happy. You get excellent treatment from all members of their staff. The food was amazing. The little oil they put on the table was ridiculously delicious. The swordfish special was better than I get in seafood restaurants. The restaurant is setup so nicely and elegant. They got every aspect covered. Top of the line spot. Go see for yourself.
Very bad staff especially the owner I was there on Saturday night and I heard the owner yelling at his waiter and that's very unprofessional..that's not how you treat your crew shame!!

Excellent food and service.  Went there for a work function with about ten or so people a few days ago on a Thursday night.  Interior is not as stuffy as I thought it would be; just elegant.  The mushroom ravioli was amazing.  The other dishes all looked pretty good for everyone too (Bronx Tail, watermelon prosciutto app, pappardelle).  I had the branzino which was fresh and cooked perfectly.   Salad was so-so.  But what shined was the amazing service throughout.  Not the cheapest but worth the money to go for both service and food.
Excellent service and food. Classy restaurant with dim lighting. Very good for a first date!

this place is horrific. if i could give it zero stars i would. i happen to know the restaurant business very well and this place is just alive because of chazz name... everyone wants to be a gangster huh? #1 the waiters- i dont want to hear you having a conversation to the other waiters across the dining room ( i couldnt even believe it). the food is ok nothing to brag about! please get new professional waitstaff, maybe even some italian instead of albanian so they can speak to your italian customers in italian.. maybe?

Chazz Palminreri Ristorante has absolutely fantastic upscale Italian food, chaotic unskilled service, and is very nice place to dine (just to say you've been there).Service: Outside of the highly professional host and captains, the waiters seem to be disorganized. Several seemed to have just received their apron and order pads the night we visited. They knew nothing of the evening's specials, a particular dish's components, the price points, or the selections on the wine lists. Example: in the first 10 minutes, three different waiters asked if we wanted bottled water or tap water? How about a drink?The wine list at Chazz's has great depth and variety. It is superior. You will quickly determine how a lot of skill went into building a dynamic list  of wines from Italy and around the globe. However, our (unskilled) waiter comes to our table with a bottle of wine that was completely opposite of what we ordered - and then had the nerve to doubt you right in front of your guests. After looking up the wine's (bin) number in front of you, he simply walks away in silence when HIS gaffe is self-confirmed. (Forget the wine for now young man, just get us another round of drinks!)Food: The grilled octopus hits big on all flavor points - you won't find better anywhere in this city. The short rib and pasta special was amazing, as well as the veal ragout. Ordinary dishes such as the chicken or veal parm were very good and beyond expectation. Highest praise goes to the chefs at Chazz!I'd venture that one can probably find the same meal at Patsy's, Joey G's or Angelo's - albeit with much less ambiance. But, go check out Chazz's ... just because it's Chazz's! Again, amazing food with inattentive service. However, maybe you'll do better than us when you go. And, I mean GO!

Above Outstanding - the food is delicious and looks presentable. The stuff and the manager are amazingly doing great job to satisfy the customers. the environment is sumptuous. If you have never been there, I advice you to visit it at lease once - because you will love it.

I was walking by with my lady, and came across Chaz's place... and thought it was cool that one of our favorite actors had an Italian restaurant in our city.  Thinking we Italian would be a great option for the night, we threw caution to the wind, quickly looked up the reviews online, and felt it would be a great decision.... boy were we wrong.The night started off well, as we were pleasantly greeted & seated very quickly - but that's where the superb service ended.(Timeliness)At the start, my date and I sat there for waaaaay too long before even being approached by a waiter - and to be asked if we would like a beverage, wine, water, etc.The gent who then came over to take our order was very rushed and not the best table manner.  (Food)We ordered calamari as the appetizer, which was very good, but a tad under-cooked... but still good quality.  The wine came at the same time.(still rarely seeing the waiter for any beverage needs - I sipped my only glass of water) As we were down to the last few bites of our calamari, the waiter then brought out the main courses.  I ordered the linguini with red clam sauce... which was HORRIBLE!!!  Seriously though, it was a.
