IG clump of noodles and sauce... stuck together, and obviously dried out under a heat-lamp.  It was a joke just trying to twirl the pasta onto my fork.  In addition to the lousy pasta... the clams were placed around the perimeter of the plate - and were obviously cooked/steamed separately from the sauce, because they had no flavor of the sauce - and the sauce had no flavor of the clams.(The Final Moments)After we were both done... and obviously not engaging in eating any longer,  the wait staff had NO CLUE of social cues - and just kept walking by us, without ANY engagement.  It wasn't until 15 minutes later, when I had to signal for the check, did they approach and ask if we wanted dessert or our food wrapped to go.I truly was disappointed in this experience and felt that Olive Garden could've cooked a better dish and a more engaging experience.

I like what they're doing here.  Real stemware, fresh linens, nice wines by the glass, good portions and frankly, pretty good prices.  Most of the apps, wines and drinks are closer to $10 than to $20.  For the level of service we were pleased in terms of value.Try not to fill up on the tasty cheese and olives with bread and garlicky olive oil they bring out to start.
A great little taste of old school New York. The service was solid, the food was delicious, and the pricing wasn't outrageous. Will definitely return!
Absolutely lovevthis place- food was amazing and service was great- our waiter was great too   Had parpardele bolognese which was amazing  and hubby had the chicken parm which he loved

Great ambiance, terrific food, top notch staff that always delivers. And it's great to run into Chazz Palminteri in person -- a true gentleman and a real life star. One of my favorite spots in NYC. Gotta try - fugetaboutit

Restaurant week - Sunday brunch - good deal - $29 three coursesHighlight: Pork Tenderloin scallopini sauteed in a port wine mushroom sauceThe pork was incredibly tender and succulent! And the sauce was the magic touch that made everything on this plate delicious!Also worth noting, the servers are authentically Italian!

We went for a late lunch yesterday, the food was delicious. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly hostess. The restaurant smelled wonderful, like Mom was in the kitchen cooking her homemade tomato sauce. We opted for the restaurant week menu, I had the pork and my husband had the veal entree both were excellent! Nicolas, the manager and the staff were attentive and provided excellent service. I can't wait to go back.

Had dinner last night with a group of friends for a birthday, the food was very good, and the staff was super nice. I ordered the risotto with seafood, and it was very good! We also had the grilled octopus and it was fantastic! Prices were a little high, but that's expected for the area, and the type of restaurant. Only issue I had was the music was what seemed to be only 5 songs that were on a loop, drove me nuts. The bartender was also a total smoke show  too, not sure I'll be coming back anytime soon because I don't spend much time midtown, but strongly suggest trying this place out if your in the area.

This is definitely an old school establishment. I felt like I was a little girl in a big boy restaurant. Putting that aside, I had the best seafood risotto. There was no skimping on the squid, shrimp, scallop, clams, and mussels. In fact I had a hard time even letting my date have a taste.#ccawentures

Let me start by telling you that, normally, I would avoid any place associated with a celebrity like the plague.  (And this is in spite of the fact that I really like Chazz Palminteri.  I just figure it's probably a tourist trap if a celebrity name is attached to it.)  But someone recommended this to a friend and he made a reservation and, what the hell, I'm game.  I was quite pleasantly surprised.  The place is absolutely charming.  It's light enough for you to see your food but dim enough to be a good place to have a romantic date.  The restaurant is on more than one level which added to the ambience and has a wonderful, warm, understated elegant feel to it.   Even the bar area looked like a nice place to stop in for a drink.  The food did not disappoint.  I had a salad with artichokes and arugula that was easily big enough for two.  The duck ravioli was a bit on the sweet side (think almost an Asian taste although it was cassis that added to the sweetness) but the duck was delicious (and the sauce was perfect for duck) and the ravioli tasted homemade and were nice and al dente.  I thought it was delicious.  I was actually too full for dessert but I noticed they had two of my favorites....zabaglioni and millefoglie so I had to taste one.  I went with the millefoglie and the pastry was so light and flaky, just as it should be, and the cream was rich but at the same time not too heavy.   I also noticed that they offered fresh fruit and sorbets which I prefer once summer comes.  Most important, as I have gotten VERY fussy about service these days, our waiter Matt was attentive without being pushy or obnoxious.  Trust me, it can be a fine line between being there when needed and being annoying. Also, the waiters all seem to pitch in.   To sum it up, I loved the place.  If it was walking distance instead of a cab ride away I'd be there more often.  (hard to get the hubby out of ten block radius....NYC has so many good restaurants)  As it is, we will be back and I think it's a fantastic place for special occasions and romantic nights. Not at all a tourist trap.  I would recommend it. I love the elegant feel but, at the same time, business casual is fine.Addendum as of Feb 2017 --  ate here again last night and it was even better than the first time.  The only thing that's stopping me from coming here more is Second Ave traffic.  Had two specials, crab and avocado salad and a homemade fettuccine with lobster and clams and shrimp in a brandy sauce.  I am adding to this review just to tell you that both were EXCELLENT.   Lots of shrimp and about a half dozen clams.  The lobster was small but tender (not rubbery) and cleaned out of the shell for you but presented with the shell.  (presentation is important) The olive bread and herbed oil were delicious, the specials were reasonably priced for NYC (if you're from out of town the key phrase in that is "NYC" -- and that means Manhattan) and the service is great.  Place is nice.  Try it.

A nice old world style Italian restaurant.  We came here after passing by and seeing how warm and cozy it looked inside. We did not have a reservation but they welcomed us to a table anyway even though it was almost a full house.  The service was friendly and polite. We ordered family style and everything was fairly good. The fried calamari was light and perfectly done. The Tomahawk ribeye, which was a special not on the menu, was especially good.  We had a great time here and will be coming back again.
Great service. Delicious, fresh ingredients. Chateau Briand was tender and juicy. Risotto was al dente. Green beans were firm, yet cooked through. Amazing!

Some friends of mine were raving about this restaurant for a few months now and I finally got around to visiting. The place is nice and spacious and service was good. I ordered the salad to start, fish for an entrée and the food was okay. The fish was a little fishy and lacked flavor. My friend ordered the pasta and she raved about it. It is not tops on my list but if I go back, I will try the pasta

Came here with a group of six for a holiday business luncheon.  We all had the Prix Fix menu which had a lot of items to choose from for each course.  We started with the Bufala salad which everyone raved about.  Then we had 2 Salmon, 2 Steak, 1 Pork and 1 Chicken and everyone was so impressed.  I had the pork and I absolutely loved it.  The waiters were nice although I could have done without them correcting our Italian but they were super attentive so it wasn't a big deal.  We have already decided to come back again next year.  Well done.

Our table of four was satisfied with our appetizers, although I thought the watermelon that they paired with the mozzarella is out of season and was bland. My husband ordered the the buccatini carbonara, the pasta cooked al dente but the sauce was like glue. I had the pistacchio crusted halibut that seemed pistacchio-less, otherwise cooked nicely. Our dining friends enjoyed their meals, but "nothing spectacular". I also found it confusing that the waiters didn't know who ordered what, thus, I was offered someone else's meal twice until they finally got mine right, three times a charm, as they say. With all of the wonderful italian restaurants to visit in NYC, I'll return to my staple, Rossini's on 38th.

Chazz' restaurant is one of the best in NY. The food is absolutely incredible. The truffle mushroom ravioli and the short rib dish are two of the best meals I've ever eaten. Nick (the  maitre d) is wonderful and generous as is the rest of the waitstaff. I would recommend this to anyone looking to have a delicious Italian meal at a reasonable price.

I've been coming here since the place opened, and the food's been great and the service acceptable. Prices are high, but what the hey, it's Manhattan. HOWEVER, tonight was totally unacceptable, and I won't be back.  One full hour between ordering and getting the appetizer, and another 45 minutes to the main dishes.  No excuses, one apology after complaining, and a free liquor at the end to make up for a two and a half hour experience.  The food was good, not great.  Something's happened, and Chazz should look into it.

What a fabulous restaurant. From the minute we walked through the door. The hostess was so pleasant. The service was impeccable. Every waiter was the best. The food was so delicious. The pasta was homemade & the fish as fresh as can be. It is a must to put on your list of restaurants to try. You won't be disappointed.
Amazing new restaurant in. Midtown East real Italian spot Chaz palmintieri de niro a Bronx Tale in midtown East

Spectacular Italian supper on a Friday night!  We got a reservation right away and got an amazing table near the window.  Excellent service start to finish--polite, efficient, precise.  I had the watermelon and mozzarella salad--excellent.  Entree was mushroom ai funghi--delicious.  Rich and tender.  We had a half bottle of wine for $30 which was very fair and got out for $100.  Spectacular.  No Chazz sighting but maybe you will be luckier.

I am sad to drop my rating for this restaurant.  The service and food remain high quality, however the flies are a nuisance.  Yes, I get they are abundant in nature but they completely spoil your meal and appetite.  Once they land in your complimentary bread and your glass, thats it.  And to have to constantly be swatting them away is not proper table activity.  I can only imagine if this is what we experience in the front of house , are there swarms in the back?  The last two meals here I suffered through the pests and apologized to my dining companions.  Im disappointed.

came here with some friends for dinner last friday night.  we ordered 2 pasta dishes papardelle bolognese and carbonara, and the bronx tail.  pasta dishes were good, pasta was cooked well.  both had too much sauce though, especially the carbonara.  then comes the big issue.  like others have said, the lobster tail was huge.  looked ok, when i first chewed, but didnt taste like lobster at all.  tasted more like fish.  looking back, overcooked lobster should be more rubbery, but this was almost flaky.  then my friend said immediately after taking the first bite that it tasted like ammonia.  i took another bite, and still didnt taste ammonia, but it tasted like flavorless fish.  i then finally took a third bite of the lobster, and i think b/c i inhaled while chewing or had my mouth open for a sec, i finally got the overwhelming taste of ammonia.  after this, i totally lost my appetite.  my friend alerted the maitre'd, who was nice, but explained that this is common and blamed it on the food provider.  it's fine if they do this, but the restaurant should at least try changing their supplier or at least try washing the lobster with water.  he immediately took it away and took it off our bill, which was the least he could do.  after this, our dinner was pretty much done since everyone lost their appetite.  good thing we had the pastas first.  didnt even get to try the other seafood on the plate like the oysters or clams, but probably good we didnt try them.so after taking the item off our bill, which is the bare minimum of what should have been done, the waiter asks us for dessert and asks us how the lobster was.  either there is no communication or seemed like they were mocking us.  no offer of even giving us a menu to see if we wanted to order something else.  didnt even really check up on us again, they kinda glossed over the fact and probably hoped we kept it quiet while at the restaurant.  the fact that mgmt didnt respond to other bad reviews here shows they just dont care and definitely do not deserve a 4 star rating.  something fishy is going on with the reviews/yelp/stars.only good thing are the price of the whiskys, some of them are low for manhattan prices, but i wouldnt recommend coming here even for a drink

It's been a few weeks since my birthday celebration but I finally had the time to write this wonderful review.  My cousin recommended this restaurant for my birthday celebration and boy were we thrilled with his choice.  Especially being of Italian decent, I am very picky about good food.  Our waiter was Miguel and he made the whole dining experience very special.  Not only was he such a fun person to talk to, he also recommended dishes to us as this was my first time dining there.  The décor of the restaurant was very upscale and romantic, not like typical NYC storefront restaurants.  The drinks and food were fabulous and the service was amazing.  I loved the old style Italian food offered here, not the typical Nuevo Italian food offered in most restaurants today.  I can't stop bragging about this restaurant and will definitely be coming back soon.

STAY AWAY. DANGER. SPOILED, AMMONIA LACED FOOD.  I made the unfortunate decision of picking Chazz Palminteri Ristorance Italiano for dinner last Friday evening.  We were a party of 3 and expected, at worst, mediocre Italian food likely not cooked by anyone related to Italy. This would be have been fine and completely within reasonable expectations given the location and "celebrity" status of the restaurant's namesake.  We ordered 2 pastas and 2 entrees for the 3 of us to share.  The pastas were served first and were mediocre but edible- the kind of food that if hungry enough you wouldn't mind.  The next course is where disaster struck. If you find yourself in this place for some reason, DO NOT ORDER A BRONX TALE.  With an entree named after the only reason your would ever really stumble in to this place, you feel compelled to order it.  A Bronx Tale contains a dinosaur size lobster tail with a bunch of other seafood surrounding it.  After one bite of the lobster tail a taste of ammonia spread through our mouths and throat.  The "lobster" was either incredibly spoiled or cooked in ammonia.  I use the term "lobster" loosely here as I have no idea what they really served us.  When we told the manager something was wrong with this entree he matter-of-factly told us that yes, the market they buy seafood from sprays their food with chemicals to keep flies away and sometimes this occurs.  He had the attitude that this wasn't the restaurant's fault but rather the luck of the draw.  He took the entree off our bill  as one would expect but offered nothing further to us, not even a genuine apology.  Under any other circumstance they would have heard more from us that evening, but we were all genuinely terrified after taking that bite that we wanted nothing else but to leave this place as quickly as possible.  I rarely write reviews but feel the public needs to be warned about this place.  This is a genuine health concern that needs to be looked at further by the appropriate people.  I can only speak to this experience, but I am sure given what we experienced they are not buying their meats, seafood or vegetables from reputable vendors.  I implore you to stay away and visit one of the hundreds of quality restaurants in this city.

Had the lobster and seafood with fresh spinach fettuccini covered in a bad ass Brandy sauce.  Grilled octopus for an appetizer and a bottle of Cakebread Cellars 2013 Cab. The staff was very welcoming and even upgraded our bottle of wine to the much more expensive and delicious Cakebread because they were out of the bottle we requested.  Cool old school decor.   I'd love to return after work on a Friday

I had the buffalo mozzarella salad which was very good, the gnocchi was good (pesto sauce was a little too creamy).. the only thing holding me back from giving 4 stars is that it wasn't the most amazing restaurant so it wouldn't be a place I would go back to very soon

We dined there last evening. Beautiful restaurant. Very nice menu. I had scampi. They were large and deliciously prepared. Served with mashed potatoes which was different for me but it really was a great combo. My husband had osso bucco which also was very good. Great service. This restaurant has been open for 8 months. The one big negative for us was the bathroom. Only one. Door needs replaced. Soap dispenser didn't work so makes one wonder how staff is washing their hands. I would go back.

Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow!  Finally some AUTHENTIC Italian in this neighborhood.  Let's start with the gorgeous decor that greets you upon entry, as if Billy Joel's 'Scenes From An Italian Restaurant' were based on this place.  Let's follow-up with the attentive staff (I felt like I was at the Four Seasons with how quick and sharp these guys were).And then of course the're the beautiful menu: the chicken was divine.  My date had the lasagna, also perfect.  Both were prepared as if Donatello himself had sculpted food preparation.  We both started with a salad before our entrees and ended with dessert.  There was more than enough for a second meal we each took home.I can't say enough about this place, will probably make it a monthly spot.

Chaz's restaurant has a beautiful ambiance.The waiters & service are always good.Our waiter we get is usually Migual and we are always happy to have him. They are very accommodating with the menu as well.The decor is wood & red tile, Warm and inviting.It's seems to always be crowded and the clientele is very nice older professional crowd.Chazz comes in often to eat and takes photos with diners and stops to talk with them.The portions are a good size and the prices are good for what you get.There is always beautiful Italian music playing or music from any of his movies.If you are a visitor of NYC this is definitely a place to check out. If you are a New Yorker then you probably already do.

The inside is multi levels and feels more private yet it has a nice full community with the other diners.The waitstaff is attentive and eager to please.  They are not Italian, but they are knowledgeable and kind.The food I had was ordinary.  The appetizer was their special burrata.  Ho hum...tasted like the inside of a refrigerator. My main course was the tagliatelle with shrimp.  Yawn.  The pasta was a bit gluey, nothing bright about the sauce, and the shrimp were chewy.  My co-diner had some nice light gnocchi .  The wine by the glass was delicious.No interest in returning.  There's hundreds of Italian restaurants with great food.  This place has no edge.

If [redacted] is your server you're going to be pissed.  For starters, he is incapable of recommending any dish on the menu, and completely forgot to tell our table about the specials.  Who knew there were a whole bunch of them?  In regards to our meal- the spinach salad has an extremely overwhelming vinegarette that ruined the freshness that was supposed to be.  Additionally the bacon wasn't of the highest quality- if you know what I mean.  Save your money- the mussels in white sauce are mediocre at best.  Main courses were better, but not great.  Bolognese was "fine," mostly meat- no sauce.  A better one is at Pescatore down the street.  Overall, loved A Bronx Tale, but this place is for my grandparents and people who like bad Italian food or can't taste anything.  Also, if you write a bad review, they will contact you to take it down, and not nicely.

I wanted to just pick up calamari (which is supposed to be one of their best items) as an appetizer for the dinner my mom was preparing. It was a simple request, I called to order and said I would come to pick up in a few minutes. The first time I called they put me on hold and hung up but I called again. They seemed irritated by my order. I went to pick up the calamari - the restaurant wasn't busy so I didn't quite understand the reason for their abruptness on the phone over a simple order. I even left a tip, even though I picked up the food, just for their efforts. When I got home, the calamari didn't have marinara sauce, which takes all the fun out. I called just to tell them, so they would be careful with such a simple order - the hostess picked up and cut me off in the middle of my explanation, transferring me to the waiter, who then hung up. I have to note that I've picked up appetizers before and it was fine, but this experience really bothered me. I know in the bigger scheme of things, this is not a big deal - but it's really the little things that make restaurants and especially their service great. I hope they were having an off day, but this was really disappointing.

It is a nice place, but it just feels like they are trying so hard that it feels overbearing.  I found them to be a bit pushy with wine, and the food to be pretty pricey.  It's a nice spot, but maybe a little too "old school" for me.

I had lunch here at a colleague's invitation. It was short-notice, so I called the morning of to explain my food allergies and try to work out something that I could eat. The gentleman on the phone was a bit dismissive because he had another call to take, but I do understand that phones can be busy! He assured me I could speak to the waiter when I arrived, which I did. I had a plain steak and a side of greens. I cannot eat gluten due to a health condition (trust me, I really really really wish I could), and I found a crouton in my greens. Then the filet mignon that I ordered medium was fully well done in the center, with no pink. The meat was still tender though and overall tasted fine. My dining companions enjoyed their food, and the ambiance was lovely, but I probably wouldn't return and wouldn't recommend the restaurant to someone with food allergies.Edited to add: After posting this review, I was contacted by management who apologized for the issue and wrote, "Please know that we take this very seriously and will discuss diet restrictions with all our staff." Very nice of them to reach out!

I went there on Tuesday with three girlfriends. Obviously they're still going through the learning curve. The staff speaks English with a fast pronunciation which is  difficult to understand & they also misunderstood us. When an ordered drink couldn't be made by the bartender (simple Tequila sunrise) another drink was automatically substituted without asking first which was refused. A fish dish came out cold and the veal Marsala sauce was a bit too salty and had too much cream. We will return in another month to see if there are improvements. The venue is nice and convenient. The menu is quite large with something for everyone.
Place was phenomenal. Great food and very authentic Italian cuisine. The environment inside was also awesome. Our waiter provided great service was very kind and personable.
The service was spot on!!!  I had the lobster ravioli and was very good!!! They specialty cooked a dish for my wife!!!  Definitely would go back!!!

i like the actor a lot and i love that movie a bronx tale i wish him the owner the actor the very best with his restaurante  im telling folks all to go to eat there , maybe when i hit the numbers ill go but for now ill just advertise the place

The food here is amazing.  Everything is so fresh, the fish melts in your mouth.  The wait staff were friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself is beautiful.  The only criticism I have is our waiter was a little pushy with the specials and you do not get to see the prices for the specials.  Of course you can ask, which I did.  But look at the menu which have the prices and know that the specials are more expensive.  So don't be ashamed to ask.  Will definitely go back.
Great food.. Love the steak and Osso BuccoService friendly but slow.. But worth the wait
Pre-fixe lunch menu is fantastic. Excellent, clean service. Do not hesitate to go here and have the classic Italian restaurant experience, but much more phenomenal.

There were no anti paste meat and cheese sample on the menu, so our waiter insisted telling the chef to put something together for us and the dish came out divine. Service and food was nicely portioned. Wonderful catering. Our waiter told us the specials and I was impressed with how long and delicious each entree sounded. But what impressed me even more was him remembering every little detail when it came to the never-ending specials. They have a large wine list. And the restaurant had a nice crowd at 8pm. I will be honest and say the duck ravioli had a little too much sauce. Seemed like bbq sauce was poured all over. But overall, the food is worth coming back for.
Highly recommended! Outstanding service, and phenomenal food with excellent taste...

Came here to celebrate my buddies birthday. This place is outstanding! The decor is classy, intimate and cozy. The staff are very attentive, constantly looking over to see if you need anything, yet not intrusive. The food: delicious. We had baked clams and a burrata cheese appetizer. Both were fresh and tasty. The presentation was very appealing to the eye. For main course we had veal shank osso bucco over saffron risotto, and pappardelle pasta with meatballs and fresh mozzarella. The flavors were perfect. The veal was so tender it broke apart with your fork. For dessert, we had an awesome ricotta cheesecake and a zabione.  The bonus: owner Chazz Palminteri stopped by the restaurant. We asked the busboy if we could meet him and he went away for a minute. Next minute Mr Palminteri came to greet us at our table! We chatted and took photos with him. He was very friendly and a gracious host. Cannot wait to return to the restaurant for another dinner. You won't be disappointed!

Service was excellent..extremely attentive, our server was Nick. He made sure that we were satisfied from the moment we sat down until we left. Food was pretty amazing. I'm always nervous about ordering steak but at our table we ordered the rib eye which was the size of the plate and the filet mignon which was the biggest I've ever seen in my life. Decor is warm and cozy, it's not too loud..tables are spaced nicely. I read reviews about the servers not being Italian (they're from Albania) but who cares..they know that menu like the back of their hand and they take care of you and that's what's important. The food was great...service was great..we'll be back!

We came here with the family for early dinner.I have to admit that this is one of the best Italian Resturant I have been to.Service is outstanding. Ambiance is wonderful. The food that we have chosen are spectacular. They were so tasty and fresh.It's worth coming back once again.

My Manhattan drink was not properly chilled so tasted as if not enough ice was used.  My clams pasta (appetizer portion) was very good.  Was vastly underwhelmed by my chicken parmigiana entree.  Half of it felt room temperature while the sauce on it was awful.  A good Italian restaurant needs solid sauce and this place failed.   The quality of cheese on the chicken parm was unimpressive and should have baked longer.   The broccoli rabe side dish came half warm and half cold.  This is not what I expected from Chaz and company.   I did enjoy the service though.  But unless the food and bartending improves,  I won't be returning.

VERY OLD NEW YORK FEEL...Went for dinner to celebrate selling the family hotel and we were more than pleased.  We were a party of 5 and we all had a great meal. Our Albanian waiter was very attentive and took his job very  seriously. the table tried to make him laugh a little to loosen him up (it didn't work LOL). He was super polite  and so were the other gentlemen. the ambiance is very cozy, romantic and intimate. because of the low lighting you feel that you have the restaurant to yourself.Minus 1 star because the wait staff came over too many times to offer to pour the sparkling water and the bottle of wine interrupting the conversations. They were constantly around. I like attention but not to be distracted. Also, the Branzino I ate had bones, ewwwwww.

I cannot say enough nice things about this restaurant. Definitely go here if you want an authentic Italian experience. Not only was the food we ate incredible but the service was outstanding. Our server was so attentive to all of our requests and knowledgable about all of the food. I will be going back here again and again for sure!

It is the middle of a blizzard but boyfriend wanted date night anyway.  We both were craving steak.  We made a ressie on open table at Matisse to brave the sideways falling snow only to discover that it was closed.  Guess they forgot to inform open table.  We stared walking back to our apartment to discover this gem that was open.  Yes it is dark inside.  Yes you might need some help to read the menu.  But this place is cozy, sexy and romantic.  It was the perfect hideaway for our snowy evening.  We decided to order the rib eye and the oso bucco.  The pasta sounded delicious but I have pasta skills in the kitchen and their pasta is expensive.  Better to spend a bit more for the main courses.  We split the octopus with broccoli rabe.  My rib eye was cooked perfectly.  It was thick, juicy, yummy fat, perfectly pink and crispy on the outside.  The staff was attentive and very funny.  Very happy to have discovered this new date night spit in the neighborhood   We will be back

I had lunch here last week with a friend and she used to go here a lot. She was telling me about the great pizza they had, but the great pizza's are gone. It is now supposed to be a much more fancy restaurant, but I am not feeling it. The dinner meals are all overpriced, the fix price lunch was still ok with decent choices, but dont change the coffee into a cappuccino because you will end up with +$5.5 and nobody tells you up front. Also a bottle of water goes for 10 bucks which I find crazy. I do have to say that the food was not bad I had buffalo mozzarella as a starter, which was very good, calamari pasta as entree, was ok, and tiramisu as dessert, not that great. Worst thing I find the service, the waiters are not attentive, they do not speak nicely (we asked if there was any pizza and the only word in reply was "No"), and they speak in a different language to each other throughout the restaurant (not Italian), what happened to the Italian waiters?!. Definitely not worth it.

We decided to try this relatively new restaurant and are very glad we did. The food is excellent, as are the salads and specials . Wines are quite good and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Ambiance is quite nice too. It's quiet with wood paneling that adds to the romantic atmosphere. We are  looking forward to going back soon.

I had dinner here with my Dad and my wife, and we loved it. The service was phenomenal, the food was great (all except my wife didn't love her mushroom ravioli).  For appetizers we had asparagus, shrimp cocktail, and baked clams. I had chicken parm for entree and my dad had the red snapper special. We enjoyed it all. Best part of the night though was when Chazz came over, shook our hands, and talked to us for a minute. Very cool stuff. Will definitely be back.

The place is dark. At the door all patrons should be given mining hats so you can see. I ordered one of the special appetizers which was described as a salad. What I got was a glob of cheese on a plate with 2 leaves on it. Not a salad. I couldn't read the menu, it was so dark. Eventually I picked out a pasta dish that was to have broccoli rabe and sausage in it When it came I thought it was fettuccine bolognese. It had a red sauce, a lot of sausage and maybe a few twigs of regular broccoli (not broccoli rabe). I'm not going back. Just because it has a celebrity's name on it doesn't make it good. The only reason I gave it 2 stars rather than one was because the service was impeccable.

Had a great experience last week at Chazz's new restaurant.we did get to say " Hi" to Chazz.The atmosphere is warm and cozy, with great old school Frank, etc playing.The feel is rich, and classy but not overdone.The service is completely AMAZING, its so nice to got a new place, and have true blue professional servers working. They were so attentive, and knew the menu cold.we had amazing egg plant and fresh Mozz app, and had some great pasta and chicken entries.We will be back soon, we were ver impressed.Go say hi to Chazz..........

Been to this restaurant twice now. The food is decent but they have a tendency to leave out ingredients mentioned on the menu. So you may not get what you had in mind. The service should be great given the number of staff they have but instead all the servers can't wait to take away your plates. Go there if you must but pray they bring back Cafe Linda!

This is a first for me, I've never written a bad review either on yelp or opentable. However, my experience here was exceptionally bad.  I would give it less than one star but that's as low as you can go on yelp.  In fairness to the restaurant, I'm going to assume that a lot of it had to do with the start up and an exceptionally poorly trained waiter.My wife and I were regulars at Nino's, the restaurant which previously occupied this space and dined there 3 to 4 times per month and ordered takeout about the same number of times per month. So we were excited to see that a new restaurant was opening in that space. The new owners seem to have changed nothing about the decor which was fine with us. What they did change, the food and the service, was a disappointment.We were served by two waiters one seemed very friendly and knowledgeable and the other clueless. Unfortunately for us the majority of our service was provided by clueless.  The specials were described to us in two different ways. I ordered the crispy duck and my wife ordered the lobster over spinach linguine. Both dishes were inedible. I tried with the duck but gave up after a few bites. My wife, said the both the lobster and the linguine were overcooked and also gave up after a few bites.  I asked if I could switch the mashed potatoes for polenta I was told NO SUBSTITUTIONS  so I asked for a side of polenta and to not bring the mashed potatoes (I don't like to waste food).  The side of polenta was the best part of the meal but at a cost of $15.00 not worth it and the mashed potatoes were on the plate.  I then asked for a doggie bag for the duck but not the mashed potatoes (the dog doesn't like mashed potatoes either).  When I arrived home I discovered that the waiter had included the duck and the mashed potatoes.  I am not joking but the dog, which eats practically anything, will not eat the duck from this restaurant.On the way out I mentioned that our waiter didn't seem to know a lot about the menu and i was told that it was only his second day and would probably be his last to which i responded that i thought would be a very good thing.  I am willing to go back to give them a second chance to make a good first impression but my wife will not step in the place again.

I would give them 10 stars if possible !!! Our waiter jack was professional, knowledgeable and very attentive. Food was excellent and fresh. Atmosphere was warm and rich. We will definitely go back .. Oh and we missed Chaz by 20 minutes . A great find

I really enjoyed our dinner last night.  The restaurant was beautifully decorated and the staff was super nice and certainly competent.  Excellent wine list!  Oysters were super fresh,  salads were delicious,  fried calamari was light and non greasy.  Best appetizer by far was the baby artichoke app.  DELISH!  4 dinners consisting of surf & turf,  chicken and 2 chilean sea bass dinners prepared differently,  were nothing short of spectacular.  Of course the highlight was Mr. Palminteri himself and some friends having dinner a table over.  Not wanting to be an annoying fan - I simply admired from afar.    Go after 7 and there is decent amount of street parking as well as a lot right next door.  Go,  you won't regret it.

While the ambiance is nice and the staff friendly that's the only nice things I can say. We had 3 main courses linguine lobster special, veal scaloppine and salmon. The salmon was the only edible dish. The lobster was over cooked and tough. The veal was show leather. We ordered tea and it did not come in a pot but just the cup. Refills meant a second cup using the same tea bag. We asked for and got biscotti but you could've broken a tooth. One person drank all their water and the other 2 were half emptied and in 90 minutes they were never refilled.

The Atmosphere is warm and romantic! Drinks are amazing. Try any of the Bivi Vodka drinks I had the Sicilian Martini my wife, the Strawberry 54Tagliatelle with shrimp was amazing . I had the Salmon Palminteri. Chazz is such a warm host and a Great guy!!! From start to finish, the Experience is like none other!!!
